result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Diamond Latonya Jones

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Diamond Latonya Jones in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Diamond Latonya Jones.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Court reviewed Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 11:30 am. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Jury Trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt:
Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Additionally, Defense requested to address Bail. State to comply with Victim Notification. Court ordered case adjourned for Bail/Bond hearing, Final PreTrial, and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 11:30 am. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Final PreTrial scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 11:30 am. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Jury Trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Diamond Latonya Jones in Court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in Court for Diamond Latonya Jones.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Review hearing with Defendant's misdemeanor case, 21CM2987. Court reviewed Competency Report dated September 7, 2022 from Dr. Kristin Johnson. Discussion placed on the record. Parties did not contest the report. Court found the Defendant is COMPETENT TO PROCEED and REINSTATED the proceedings. Misdemeanor case, 21CM2987, transferred back to Judge Watts, Branch 15. Scheduling Conference proceeded.
Order to Produce.  Signed and Filed. nk

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Diamond Latonya Jones in Court with Attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Diamond Latonya Jones in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Contested Competency hearing with Defendant's other Case, 21CM2987 Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Dr. Deborah Collins appeared via Zoom Video Conference. Discussion placed on the record.  State challenged. Dr. Collins' Report dated May 25, 2022. Defense did not challenge Dr. Collins' Report dated May 25, 2022. Court qualified Dr. Collins to testify as an expert. Hearing proceeded. 
Sworn for the State:  Dr. Deborah Collins.  
Testimony closed. Arguments heard.
After review of all evidence, report of Dr. Collins', and testimony of Dr. Collins', Court found Defendant is NOT COMPETENT TO PROCEED AT THIS TIME, BUT LIKELY TO REGAIN COMPETENCY. Court ordered proceedings suspended. Court ordered Defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame. Court further authorized DHS to administer medications and treatment to the Defendant.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility. Court ordered Defendant transported FORTHWITH. Court ordered case adjourned for Review hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Review hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in Court, Defendant Diamond Latonya Jones not in Court, in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Doctor's Report Return with Defendant's other Case, 21CM2987. Defense appeared via Zoom Video Conference. State appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Due to COVID-19 protocol, Defendant was not able to appear for today's hearing. Court reviewed Competency Report dated May 25, 2022 from Dr. Deborah Collins. Discussion placed on the record. Defense does not contest the report; however, State contests the report and requested a contested hearing. Clerk contacted the Forensic Unit. Court ordered case adjourned for Contested Competency hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Contested Competency hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 09:30 am. Parties will appear IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Dr. Collins will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Competency Report dated May 25, 2022 and submitted by Dr. Deborah Collins; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
-signed, filed, and distributed. Clerk provided information to WFU.

Defendant Diamond Latonya Jones in Court with Attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Diamond Latonya Jones in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in Court for Plea hearing. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the Court that there is reason to believe the Defendant is not competent to proceed. Defendant also has Case 21CM2987 pending in Branch 19. Branch 46 will temporarily accept Case 21CM2987 for the Doctor's Report Return. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered Defendant examined by the Forensic Unit. Court ordered case adjourned for Doctor's Report Return. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Defendant WILL BE PRODUCED.

Defendant Diamond Latonya Jones in Court with Attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Diamond Latonya Jones in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received additional discovery from the State and reviewed same with Defendant. Defense requested a plea date. Defendant requested to appear IN-PERSON. State to comply with Victim Notification. Court ordered case adjourned for Plea hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Plea hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 03:45 pm. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Defendant WILL BE PRODUCED.

Defendant Diamond Latonya Jones in Court with Attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Diamond Latonya Jones in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr on behalf of Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material and an offer from the State. Defense requested additional time to review case with Defendant. Court granted request. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 11:30 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Diamond Latonya Jones in Court with Attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Diamond Latonya Jones in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Additional Appearances: Celena Zonoozi, Victim Witness Advocate; Dana B., Raina G., and Patricia M. 

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**  
Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Court reviewed Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. State advised the Court of Defendant's pending case, 21CF1427, in Kenosha County; and pending case, 21CM2987, in Milwaukee County. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Statements made regarding discovery material. Court ordered Defense and State to meet 48 hours in advance of the next Court date. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Defense Motion for Bail Modification; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Diamond Latonya Jones in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran; both appear by video.  Defendant Diamond Latonya Jones in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in Court for Preliminary hearing. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial. State filed original Information. Defense counsel waived reading of Information, and entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant. State to provide Defense counsel with discovery material and an offer via digital system. Case adjourned for bail review, Branch 46.
E-FILED: Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Diamond Latonya Jones in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Diamond Latonya Jones in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Diamond Latonya Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
